channel.title: Help with my compiler

item.title: Help with my compiler
item.dc:creator: @nerdboyxx nerdboyxx
item.description:
@nerdboyxx wrote:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“bank”) && (playerRights >= 1)) {
openUpBank();

}
    if (command.equals("xteleall") && (playerRights >= 3)) {
        for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) // loop so it effects all players
            if (p != null) { // weeds out the nulls from our function
                { ;clientcastOn = (client) p; // specific player's client }

                castOn.teleportToX = absX; // replace with your tele X coord
                castOn.teleportToY = absY; // replace with your tele Y coord
            }
        }
    }[/code]

The line

{ ;clientcastOn = (client) p; // specific player's client }

is the one that is giving me all the trouble this time around. Is it alright if I add more? There is three other sections it continually tells me to clean up which are giving 20 errors a pop, even more.

Another one is:

[code]PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + ": "
+ Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0))
+ text.substring(1) + “”;
} else if (muted == 1) {
sendMessage(“You are muted and you cannot yell!”);
}
}
}

public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
    if (amount > 0) {
        if (bankItems[fromSlot] > 0) {
            if (!takeAsNote) {
                if (Item.itemStackable[bankItems[fromSlot] + 1]) {
                    if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) {
                        if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), amount)) {
                            bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount;
                            resetBank();
                            resetItems(5064);
                        }
                    } else {
                        if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1),
                                bankItemsN[fromSlot])) {
                            bankItems[fromSlot] = 0;
                            bankItemsN[fromSlot] = 0;
                            resetBank();
                            resetItems(5064);
                        }[/code]

The one that is giving the trouble here is

public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {

Another one:

[code]} else {
while (amount > 0) {
if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > 0) {
if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), 1)) {
bankItemsN[fromSlot] += -1;
amount–;
} else {
amount = 0;
}
} else {
amount = 0;
}
}
resetBank();
resetItems(5064);
}
}
}
}
}

public int getXPForLevel(int level) {
    int points = 0;
    int output = 0;

    for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
        points += Math.floor(
                (double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
        if (lvl >= level) {
            return output;
        } [/code]

The one that is giving me trouble here is:

public int getXPForLevel(int level) {

Anoher one is:

[code]public int getXPForLevel(int level) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

    for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
        points += Math.floor(
                (double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
        if (lvl >= level) {
            return output;
        }
        output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
    }
    return 0;
}

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
    int points = 0;
    int output = 0;

    for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
        points += Math.floor(
                (double) lvl + 150.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
        output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
        if (output >= exp) {
            return lvl;
        }
    }
    return 99;
}[/code]

The one causing me trouble here is:

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {

Another one is:

    public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) {
        int Attack = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]);
        int Defence = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]);      
        int Strength = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]);
        int Hitpoints = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);
        int Ranging = getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]);
        int Prayer = getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]);
        int Magic = getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]);
        int Cooking = getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]);
        int Woodcutting = getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]);
        int Fletching = getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]);
        int Fishing = getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]);
        int Firemaking = getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]);
        int Crafting = getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]);
        int Smithing = getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]);
        int Mining = getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]);
        int Herblore = getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]);
        int Agility = getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]);
        int Thieving = getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]);
        int Slayer = getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]);
        int Farming = getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]);
        int Runecrafting = getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]);

        if ((amount + playerXP[skill]) < 0 || playerXP[skill] > 2000000000) {
            sendMessage("Max XP value reached");
            return false;
        }[/code]

Another one, not the last one but Im sick of the copy and paste so I will finish up here:

[code]}
        setSkillLevel(skill, playerLevel[skill], playerXP[skill]);
        refreshSkills();
        if (skill == 2) {
            CalculateMaxHit();
        }
        return true;

    }

    public boolean bankItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
        if (playerItemsN[fromSlot] <= 0) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!Item.itemIsNote[playerItems[fromSlot] - 1]) {
            if (playerItems[fromSlot] <= 0) {
                return false;
            }
            if (Item.itemStackable[playerItems[fromSlot] - 1]
                    || playerItemsN[fromSlot] > 1) {
                int toBankSlot = 0;
                boolean alreadyInBank = false;

                for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) {
                    if (bankItems[i] == playerItems[fromSlot]) {
                        if (playerItemsN[fromSlot] < amount) {
                            amount = playerItemsN[fromSlot];
                        }
                        alreadyInBank = true;
                        toBankSlot = i;
                        i = playerBankSize + 1;
                    }
                }

The line of code here that is nagging me is:

    public boolean bankItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {

That is a lot to answer and read through, if anyone could find the time to read through it Id be really grateful. I have done what was asked, I took smples of the code around the source of the problem and outlined what exact line of code was causing me trouble.

After this lot are done, I will post up a second lot thank you very VERY much if you take the time to actually bother to answer this question.

The line that is causing me trouble here is:

    public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) {

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my compiler
item.dc:creator: @nerdboyxx nerdboyxx
item.description:
@nerdboyxx wrote:

Here is an example:

In the compiler it said: “Illegal start of type”

Here is a sample of the code and some of the code around it:

[code]try {
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name);
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];

            c.playerRights = 0;
            c.savemoreinfo();
            c.savechar();
            c.disconnected = true;
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (name
                    + " is no longer a member of staff");
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage(name + " either isn't online or doesn't exist");
        }

addItem(1762,1);
addItem(0612,999999999);
sendMessage(“You have used the voule command maker”);
sendMessage(“You have left to spend”);
}

    } // Coded By T R A X

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase ;"BlackCavs" & playerRights; >= 1){
   addItem(2644,2147000000);
   sendMessage("W00t Black Cavs!");
    }

if (command.startsWith(“jail”) && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 1) {
if(teleblock == true){
sendMessage(“A magical force stops you from teleporting.”); //made by cody
}[/code]

Here is the exact line of code that the compiler says the error is coming from;

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase ;“BlackCavs” & playerRights; >= 1){

That is unedited from the client.java file, the source of all my troubles if you could find out the problem that would be great. Remember, I have 99 other errors like this. If I have to change all of them Im going to snap

I think the problem is too many brackets or too few, I will do some editing and go over the entire thing once again and see if I missed anything.

Read full topic
